items.prompt: Which instrument gives the right, but not the obligation, to sell an asset at a specific price?
items.explanation: A put option provides the right to sell; a call option provides the right to buy.

items.prompt: ________ have we seen such volatility in the derivatives market as we did during the last quarter.
items.explanation: This uses formal inversion for emphasis: 'Seldom + auxiliary + subject'.

items.prompt: What is the primary purpose of an 'Interest Rate Swap'?
options: To bet on the price of gold
To exchange interest rate payments (e.g., fixed for floating) to manage exposure
To borrow money from a foreign bank at a lower rate
To buy stocks in another company without paying cash
items.explanation: Interest rate swaps allow parties to exchange payment streams to hedge or adjust interest rate risk.

items.prompt: It is imperative that the trader ________ with all margin requirements to avoid liquidation.
items.explanation: This is the subjunctive mood after 'imperative that' (base form of the verb).

items.prompt: A '________' is a demand by a broker for more cash to cover potential losses on a leveraged position.
items.explanation: A margin call occurs when the value of an account falls below the maintenance margin requirement.
